article_title: France Urges G-7 to Invest in Renewable Energy in Africa
article_text:
French Foreign Minister Laurent Fabius called on the Group of Seven leading industrialized countries to boost investment in renewable energy projects in Africa to offset the impact the continent’s economic rise is likely to have on global carbon emissions.

The effort to keep Africa from pumping copious amounts of carbon into the air is becoming a focal point of France’s plans to host the United Nations Climate Change Conference in December. French officials warn the long-term goal of reining in rising temperatures will...

article_summary:
French officials warn the long-term goal of reining in rising temperatures will...
French Foreign Minister Laurent Fabius called on the Group of Seven leading industrialized countries to boost investment in renewable energy projects in Africa to offset the impact the continent’s economic rise is likely to have on global carbon emissions.
The effort to keep Africa from pumping copious amounts of carbon into the air is becoming a focal point of France’s plans to host the United Nations Climate Change Conference in December.
